title: Move to Brasília, Distrito Federal

sections.heading: Move to Brasília, Distrito Federal
sections.summary: Visa, residency, housing, and daily-life guidance tailored for Brasília.

blocks.text: Visa, residency, housing, and daily-life guidance tailored for Brasília.
Start here: pick a visa, prep documents, and land with a checklist.

sections.heading: Quick facts about Brasília
highlights: Region: Distrito Federal
Language: Portuguese (English limited; plan basic phrases)
Money: Brazilian Real (BRL) — cards widely accepted, carry some cash
Connectivity: Prepaid SIMs at airports and malls; bring passport
Healthcare: SUS (public) for emergencies; private plan recommended
Safety basics: Use ride-hailing at night, avoid flashing valuables, use ATMs inside malls

items: Region: Distrito Federal
Language: Portuguese (English limited; plan basic phrases)
Money: Brazilian Real (BRL) — cards widely accepted, carry some cash
Connectivity: Prepaid SIMs at airports and malls; bring passport
Healthcare: SUS (public) for emergencies; private plan recommended
Safety basics: Use ride-hailing at night, avoid flashing valuables, use ATMs inside malls

sections.heading: Visa and residency game plan
sections.summary: Pick a pathway: work visa (job offer + sponsor), digital nomad (income proof), student (school enrollment), family reunion, or investment.
highlights: Pick a pathway: work visa (job offer + sponsor), digital nomad (income proof), student (school enrollment), family reunion, or investment.
Prepare documents: passports, criminal checks, income proof, health insurance, translations + apostilles where required.
Enter and register: get your CPF, schedule Federal Police registration if your visa demands it, and keep copies of entry stamp and receipts.
Renewals and permanence: track expiry, keep address updated, and retain proof of residence and tax filings.

items: Pick a pathway: work visa (job offer + sponsor), digital nomad (income proof), student (school enrollment), family reunion, or investment.
Prepare documents: passports, criminal checks, income proof, health insurance, translations + apostilles where required.
Enter and register: get your CPF, schedule Federal Police registration if your visa demands it, and keep copies of entry stamp and receipts.
Renewals and permanence: track expiry, keep address updated, and retain proof of residence and tax filings.

sections.heading: Arrival checklist for Brasília
sections.summary: CPF number (tax ID) for banking, rentals, and utilities.
highlights: CPF number (tax ID) for banking, rentals, and utilities.
Bank account: start with a digital bank if paperwork is lighter; upgrade to full-service once you have proof of address.
Mobile + internet: prepaid SIM at airport/mall; confirm eSIM support if you prefer digital activation.
Proof of address: lease + utility bill; some banks accept signed declarations plus a host’s bill.
Federal Police: book appointments early for biometrics or registration steps tied to your visa.

items: CPF number (tax ID) for banking, rentals, and utilities.
Bank account: start with a digital bank if paperwork is lighter; upgrade to full-service once you have proof of address.
Mobile + internet: prepaid SIM at airport/mall; confirm eSIM support if you prefer digital activation.
Proof of address: lease + utility bill; some banks accept signed declarations plus a host’s bill.
Federal Police: book appointments early for biometrics or registration steps tied to your visa.

sections.heading: Housing and neighborhoods
sections.summary: Search channels: local classifieds, Facebook groups, brokers, and portal sites; confirm if furniture is included (often unfurnished).
highlights: Search channels: local classifieds, Facebook groups, brokers, and portal sites; confirm if furniture is included (often unfurnished).
Documents owners ask for: CPF, ID/passport, proof of income, and a guarantor or deposit; short-term rentals may accept upfront payment instead.
Due diligence: walk the area by day and evening, test mobile signal, ask about noise and flood history, check commute options.

items: Search channels: local classifieds, Facebook groups, brokers, and portal sites; confirm if furniture is included (often unfurnished).
Documents owners ask for: CPF, ID/passport, proof of income, and a guarantor or deposit; short-term rentals may accept upfront payment instead.
Due diligence: walk the area by day and evening, test mobile signal, ask about noise and flood history, check commute options.

sections.heading: Cost of living snapshot
highlights: Rent: varies by neighborhood; furnished short-lets cost more.
Utilities: electricity, gas, water, internet — confirm if included in rent.
Food: mix of supermarkets and open-air markets; eating out ranges widely by district.
Transport: rideshare, bus, and intercity options; consider a transport card where available.
Healthcare: private plan or pay-per-use clinics; keep emergency cash for co-pays.

items: Rent: varies by neighborhood; furnished short-lets cost more.
Utilities: electricity, gas, water, internet — confirm if included in rent.
Food: mix of supermarkets and open-air markets; eating out ranges widely by district.
Transport: rideshare, bus, and intercity options; consider a transport card where available.
Healthcare: private plan or pay-per-use clinics; keep emergency cash for co-pays.

sections.heading: Healthcare and insurance
sections.summary: Emergency care is available via SUS; bring ID and proof of address when possible.
highlights: Emergency care is available via SUS; bring ID and proof of address when possible.
Private plans speed up specialist access; compare nationwide vs regional networks.
Pharmacies ("farmácias") are widespread; many offer discount programs.

items: Emergency care is available via SUS; bring ID and proof of address when possible.
Private plans speed up specialist access; compare nationwide vs regional networks.
Pharmacies ("farmácias") are widespread; many offer discount programs.

sections.heading: Work, freelancing, and business setup
sections.summary: Employment: job offer + sponsored work visa; keep contract copies and payslips.
highlights: Employment: job offer + sponsored work visa; keep contract copies and payslips.
Freelance: ensure visa permits remote work; declare income for taxes.
Company: common formats are MEI (micro-entrepreneur) and Ltda; work with a local accountant for registration and taxes.

items: Employment: job offer + sponsored work visa; keep contract copies and payslips.
Freelance: ensure visa permits remote work; declare income for taxes.
Company: common formats are MEI (micro-entrepreneur) and Ltda; work with a local accountant for registration and taxes.

sections.heading: Education and language
sections.summary: Public schools exist; private and international schools vary by city size.
highlights: Public schools exist; private and international schools vary by city size.
Portuguese courses: language schools, private tutors, and online options; start early to handle paperwork and daily life.

items: Public schools exist; private and international schools vary by city size.
Portuguese courses: language schools, private tutors, and online options; start early to handle paperwork and daily life.

sections.heading: Daily life and practical tips
sections.summary: Transport: mix of rideshare, bus, and intercity coaches; check peak-hour traffic patterns.
highlights: Transport: mix of rideshare, bus, and intercity coaches; check peak-hour traffic patterns.
Money habits: use cards where possible; avoid street ATMs; keep receipts.
Documents: carry a passport copy and your CPF; store originals securely.
Weather prep: pack for seasonal rain and heat; dehumidifiers help protect electronics.

items: Transport: mix of rideshare, bus, and intercity coaches; check peak-hour traffic patterns.
Money habits: use cards where possible; avoid street ATMs; keep receipts.
Documents: carry a passport copy and your CPF; store originals securely.
Weather prep: pack for seasonal rain and heat; dehumidifiers help protect electronics.

sections.heading: Community and integration
sections.summary: Find locals and newcomers through language exchanges, coworking spaces, sports groups, and volunteer events. Join moderated online groups to ask city-specific questions and meetup safely in public places.

blocks.text: Find locals and newcomers through language exchanges, coworking spaces, sports groups, and volunteer events. Join moderated online groups to ask city-specific questions and meetup safely in public places.

sections.heading: 90-day relocation timeline
sections.summary: Sequence every step before and after landing.
highlights: Week 1: pick the visa path and confirm Federal Police slots in Brasília.
Week 2: translate and apostille core documents in Brasília.
Week 3: secure CPF and open a bank that issues a debit card quickly in Brasília.
Week 4: line up two housing options with signed intent letters in Brasília.
Week 5: map commute times at rush hour in Brasília.
Week 6: book health insurance start dates in Brasília.
Week 7: prepare notarized copies of passports and CPF in Brasília.
Week 8: print emergency numbers and hospital addresses in Brasília.
Week 9: double-check proof of address acceptable to banks in Brasília.
Week 10: run a full budget and cash buffer for 3 months in Brasília.

sections.heading: Documents and translations
sections.summary: Keep originals and digital copies in synced storage.
highlights: Document 1: passport valid 6+ months with two copies in Brasília.
Document 2: police clearance with apostille in Brasília.
Document 3: income proof and bank statements for affordability checks in Brasília.
Document 4: marriage or birth certificates translated by sworn translator in Brasília.
Document 5: vaccination records stored digitally and printed in Brasília.
Document 6: CPF printout plus digital backup in Brasília.
Document 7: proof of address from lease, utility, or declaration in Brasília.
Document 8: health insurance certificate in Portuguese in Brasília.
Document 9: work contract or offer letter ready for HR in Brasília.
Document 10: student enrollment letters if applicable in Brasília.
